subject: Personal Finance
title: Mental Accounting
description: A quick win: understand Mental Accounting.

hook.text: You protect your savings but blow a $200 bonus in a day. Same money, different label.

buildup.text: Richard Thaler found that people sort money into invisible mental buckets and treat each differently.

discovery.text: Rent money feels sacred. Gift money feels disposable. Casino winnings feel like play money.

twist.text: People keep credit card debt while building savings. The labels override basic math.

climax.text: Thaler won a Nobel Prize for this insight. Our brains sort dollars like colored marbles.

punchline.text: Money is fungible. Your brain disagrees.

quiz.question: What did Thaler call our tendency to treat money differently based on its source?
